Replies.Reply: Ha - Ha -
Look down, look down You're here until you die.
Look down, look down There's twenty years to go.
Look down, look down Sweet Jesus doesn't care.
Look down, look down Don't look'em in the eye.
Look down, look down You'll always be a slave.
Look down, look down You'll always be a slave.
Ha - Ha -
How long, O Lord Before you let me die?
I've done no wrong Sweet Jesus, hear my prayer!
I know she'll wait I know that she'll be true -
When I get free You won't see me Here for dust!
No! It means you get Your yellow ticket-of-leave.
This badge of shame You'll show it everywhere.
You will starve again Unless you learn the meaning of the law.
Five years for what you did, The rest because you tried to run.
And I'm Javert!
I introduce myself, Inspector of Police.
You've done the city proud, You've raised their banner high.
You manufacture gems That anyone can buy Your people thrive.
It seems to me We may have met.
Can this be true?
Forgive me, sir.
Monsieur le Mayor.
Tell me quickly what's the story.
She will answer for her actions When you make a full report.
I have heard such protestations Every day for twenty years.
Save your breath and save your tears.
Monsieur le Mayor!  Javert looks on, containing his anger, as Valjean reaches out a hand to Fantine. To Fantine, it's as if he's come to her in a dream -
Monsieur le Mayor I have a crime to declare!
I mistook you for a convict, I have made a false report.
And of course the thief denies it, You'd expect that from a con.
He will pay, and so must I.
Must I do as you say?
Valjean, at last We see each other plain!
You must think me mad!
Men like me can never change.
Now the wheel has turned around -
There is no place for you to hide.
Wherever you may hide away -
Where's the child Cosette?
Did you catch the fellow's name?
Another brawl in the square!
Monsieur, these streets are not safe.
Look upon this fine collection Crawled from underneath a stone.
But where's the gentlemen gone?
Could it be he's that old jailbird That the tide now washes in?
And the girl who stood beside him, When I turned they both had gone.
Let the old man keep on running I will run him off his feet!
Everyone about your business!
Clear this garbage off the street!
There, out in the darkness A fugitive running Running from God Fallen from grace -
And your aim And each in your season Returns and returns And is always the same And if you fall As Lucifer fell You fall In flame!
One day more to revolution.
I will join these people's heroes I will follow where they go.
One more day to revolution We will nip it in the bud We'll be ready for these schoolboys -
I can find out the truth!
Listen, my friends, I have done as I said.
I have overheard their plans.
Shoot me now or shoot me later -
The law is inside out.
You've hungered for this all your life.
Don't understand...
Valjean, take care!
Once a thief, forever a thief.
I warned you I would not give in!
The man of mercy comes again And talks of justice!
One more step and you die.
Take him, Valjean, Before I change my mind!
Who is this man?
Damned if I live in the debt of a thief!
I am the law and the law is not mocked!
And my thoughts fly apart Can this man be believed?
I am reaching but I fall And the stars are black and cold As I stare into the void Of a world that cannot hold...
Yes. It means I'm free.
I stole a loaf of bread My sister's child was close to death And we were starving.
I know the meaning of those nineteen years A slave of the law!
My name is Jean Valjean!
Freedom at last -
And now lets see What this new world Will do for me!
Jailer. Would you let me stay here for tonight?
Pontarlier.
No. The destination is compulsory.
You let me sleep here next to you?
What have I done?
I feel my shame inside me like a knife.
I am reaching, but I fall And the night is closing in...
Another story must begin!  He rips the yellow paper into pieces and throws the pieces out over the valley. The scraps flutter in the wind.
What is this fighting all about?
Now come on, ladies, settle down.
Deal with this, Foreman. Be as patient as you can.  He walks back to the stairs up to his office.  On the factory floor -
Welcome, sir Come guard our laws I'm sure we're here In common cause.
The dignity of toil To stay alive.
Your face is not a face I would forget.
Get back! It may fall!
Say what you must.
A moment of your time, Javert.
You've done your duty. Let her be.
Where will she end -
I've seen your face before.
Is it true what I've done -
- to an innocent soul?
Had I only known then!
In His name my task has just begun.
Where is she?
I don't understand.
You say this man denies it all, And gives no sign of understanding or repentance?
You have only done your duty It's a minor sin at most.
It's your duty to obey!
They think that man is me -
I am the master of hundreds of workers -
Can I conceal myself for ever more?
My soul belongs to God, I know, I made that bargain long ago.
And so, your honour, you see it's true That man bears no more guilt than you!
If you don't believe me ask Inspector Javert. He knows where to find me.
Is her daughter with her?
Thenardier.' What sort of man is this?
Be at peace! Be at peace ever more.
- shall live in my protection.
Your child will want for nothing.
And none shall ever harm Cosette as long as I am living.
Then I will keep you warm.
Take shelter from the storm.
Before you say another word, Javert, Before you chain me up like a slave again, Listen to me! There is something I must do.
Believe of me what you will There is a duty that I'm sworn to do.
I am warning you, Javert, I'm a stronger man by far!
And this I swear to you tonight -
Your child will live within my care -
And I will raise her to the light.
Hush now, do not be afraid of me.
Tell me, my child, what is your name?
Cosette?
I found her wandering in the wood This little child, I found her trembling in the shadows.
I will not forget my vow.
Cosette shall have a father now.
Your feelings do you credit, sir.
Now may I say we are agreed?
No more! Here's your price!
Where I go, you will be.
Yes, Cosette!
Suddenly I see Suddenly it starts When two anxious hearts Beat as one.
And delight.
Who are you?
Now you can do the same for me.
We'll give thanks for what is granted What the sisters may ordain Here we pray for new beginnings -
What is this? Are you mad?
Dear Cosette, You're such a lonely child.
No more words -
You will learn.
Cosette! Cosette!  Cosette turns and runs in to the house.
My God, Cosette!
This is a warning to us all!
Must be Javert.
We must get away from shadows That will never let us be.
Hurry, Cosette! Prepare to leave, And say no more.
Hurry, Cosette!
One day more!
One day more!
One day more!
Tomorrow we'll be far away.
I'll take it.
entered my soul And soon you will be gone.
I come here as a volunteer.
That's why they let me through.
There's much that I can do.
Give me no thanks, M'sieur.
Give me the spy Javert!
We meet again...
You talk too much.
Get out of here.
Clear out of here!
You are wrong, and always have been wrong.
Go!
In my need You have always been there.
Let me go!
How do I get out of here?
It's you, Javert!
Another hour yet And then I'm yours And all our debts are paid.
Come, time is running short -
Then I die.
She was never mine to keep She is youthful, she is free...
Not another word, my son.
There lived a man whose name was Jean Valjean.
Years ago, He broke parole and lived a life apart...
Make her believe I have gone on a journey A long way away.
...What I have spoken, why I must go.
Alone I wait in the shadows I count the hours till I can sleep.
I am ready, Fantine...
Cosette?
Cosette, my child! Am I forgiven now?
Now you are here Again beside me Now I can die in peace For now my life is blessed...
Yes, Cosette, forbid me now to die!
On this page I write my last confession.
I'm ready now, Fantine.
Forgive me all my trespasses And take me to your glory!
My inn is full.
This is a prison, not an inn. Get yourself arrested. Then we will open up for you.
Come in, sir, for you are weary And the night is cold out here.
There is wine here to revive you.
Sit, my brother.
Madame, set one more place.
Please sit.
May the Lord bless the food we eat today. Bless our dear sister and our honoured guest.
Please, eat. Where are you travelling to my brother?
Is that where your family is?
Then let this be your home, for as long as you need it.
Sleep well. Tomorrow morning before you leave you will have a cup of milk from our cows, nice and hot.
God will take care of that.
That is right.
But my friend, you left so early, You forgot I gave these also.
Messieurs, release him.
But remember this, my brother -
By the passion and the blood, God has raised you out of darkness -
Monsignor, we caught the thief red-handed! He has the nerve to say you gave him all this!
At the end of the day you get nothing for nothing!
And in a bed!
Now someone say how this began!
I might have known the bitch could bite!
Right, my girl! On your way!
No, Monsieur le Mayor!
There are children back at home -
He's no fool..
It's no wonder they made him the mayor!
And the children have got to be fed.
And the boss, he never knows That the foreman is always on heat.
And you're lucky to be in a job -
He's a riddle..
Bless the man who leads the way!
At the end of the day she'll be nothing but trouble And there's trouble for all when there's trouble for one!
She'll be nothing but trouble again and again!
Sack the girl today!
Have you seen how the foreman is fuming today With his terrible breath and his wandering hands?
And what have we here, little innocent sister?
Come on, Fantine, let's have all the news.
There's a kid that she's hiding in some little town.
You can guess how she picks up the extra -
She's been laughing at you While she's having her men!
It's because little Fantine won't give him his way.
Take a look at his trousers, you'll see where he stands!
You must sack her today!
Give that letter to me It is none of your business.
Yes, it's true there's a child And the child is my daughter And her father abandoned us, Leaving us flat.
M'sieur Mayor, help me! I have a child!
Alright, five.  The pawnbroker takes the locket in exchange for the money.  An old woman leers at Fantine from the shadows, beckoning. She approaches Fantine, reaching out to stroke her hair.
Don't touch me! Leave me alone!
It pays a debt...
What can I do? It pays a debt.
You'll pay me first What I am due.
Easy money lying on a bed.
There was a time when men were kind, When their voices were soft And their words inviting.
Then I was young and unafraid And dreams were made and used and wasted.
I don't want you! No! No, M'sieur! Let me go!
I'll kill you, you bastard!
I beg you, don't report me, sir.
There's a child who sorely needs me, Please, m'sieur, she's but that high.
Can this be?
M'sieur, don't mock me now, I pray It's hard enough I've lost my pride.
My daughter's close to dying.
If there's a God above -
He'd let me die instead.
Bring Cosette back to me.
At an inn in Montfermeil...
Cosette, it's turned so cold!

Don't you see, the evening star appearing? Come to me, and rest against my shoulder, How fast the minutes fly away and every minute colder?  Valjean enters, and sees at once that Fantine is close to the end. He drops to his knees by her bed.
My Cosette -
Take her now!
Good m'sieur, you come from God in heaven.
Take my hand...
Take my child I give her to your keeping.
For God's sake, please stay till I am sleeping...
M'sieur I bless your name...
M'sieur lay down your burden...
Come with me Where chains will never bind you All your grief At last, at last behind you Lord in heaven Look down on him in mercy -
It'll kill you as well!
Do you hear the people sing Singing the song of angry men?
When the beating of your heart Echoes the beating of the drums There is a life about to start When tomorrow comes!
Will you join in our crusade?
Monsieur le Mayor, you come from God!
Who's that?
Why, it's Monsieur Mayor!
You saved my life! You got me this job as a gardener!
In this place of Holy Orders You are brought to God's domain May the sisters grant you shelter May their prayers ease your pain.
A bit of skirt, She's the one sold her hair.
Make money in your sleep!
I smell women!
Seven months at sea can make you Hungry for a poke!
Even stokers need a little stoke!
What pretty hair!
Let's make a price.
Just think of that.
God, we're weary, Sick enough to drop!
Old men, young men, take'em as they come!
Got a lot of callers But they never stay for long...
I do it fast, I know my business all right.
You'll get twice If I take two!
She's got a kid, Sends her all that she can.
Join your sisters -
Belly burns like fire, Will the bleeding ever stop!
Only joking!
Cheer up, deary!
Gimme the dirt -
I might've known There is always some man.
Lovely lady, come along and join us!
You're no grander than the rest of us.
That's right, dearie, Show him what you've got!
Life has dropped you at the bottom of the heap.
That's right, dearie, Let him have the lot!
Here's something new. I think I'll give it a try.
Is this a trick? I won't pay more!
You've got some nerve, you little slut!
By Christ you'll pay for what you've done!
Make your excuse to the police!
Javert, would you believe it? I was walking, it was dark When this prostitute attacked me You can see she's left her mark!
No, monsieur. Her guardian sent this.
There is a castle on a cloud I like to go there in my sleep.
Please do not send me out alone.
I'm called Cosette.
Will you be like a Papa to me?
How strange -
Does he see what I see?
There's so little I know That I'm longing to know Of the man that you were In a time long ago...
In my life I'm no longer a child and I yearn For the truth that you know Of the years... Years ago!
A heart full of love!
And mine's Cosette.
Then make no sound.
I am found!
This is a chain we'll never break.
I'm awake.
A heart full of you -
I knew it too!
Every day...
Three men I saw beyond the wall...
Please give this to Marius! He must know where to find me.
Tomorrow you'll be worlds away And yet with you my world has started!
Every day You walk with stronger step, You walk with longer step.
Don't think about it, Marius!
A heart full of love A night full of you The words are old But always true.
I saw you waiting and I knew -
At your call!
He can't leave us now What's our wedding day Without him giving me away?
Papa, papa, I do not understand -
You will live, papa You're going to live It's too soon Too soon to say goodbye.
I know it, papa.
Now look who's here!
Eponine, come my dear.
Still there, Cosette?
Enough of that, or I'll forget to be nice!
I used to dream That I would meet a prince But God almighty Have you seen what's happened since?
Master and a half!
Don't make me laugh!
Hypocrite and toady And inebriate!
Raise it up the master's arse!
Let me take your coat, m'sieur!
Take a chair!
Cosette!
That would quite fit the bill If she hadn't so often been ill.
Not enough!
There's a copper at the door!
She's gone with a gent, Didn't tell us where they went, Didn't leave his home address.
You're a bloody fool Look at what we got.
Wait a bit! Know that face!
Ain't the world a remarkable place!
You pay!
How's about some extra On a day so glad Our little orphan girl She hasn't done so bad. Raised in a convent Cash to spare - We want our share.
Watch'em till they drop!
Mine host Thenardier He was there, so they say, At the field of Waterloo.
Got there, it's true, When the fight was all through But he knew just what to do.
Picking through the pockets of the English dead.
He made a tidy score from the spoils of war.
My band of soaks, My den of dissolutes, My dirty jokes, my always pissed as newts, My sons of whores, Spend their lives in my inn!
Welcome, m'sieur!
As for the rest -
Master of the house!
Tells a saucy tale Makes a little stir Customers appreciate a bon-viveur Glad to do a friend a favour Doesn't cost me to be nice But nothing gets you nothing Everything has got a little price!
Master of the house!
Making up the weight Picking up their knick-knacks When they can't see straight Everybody loves a landlord Everybody's bosom friend!
But lock up your valises -
Enter, messieurs! Lay down yer load Unlace yer boots And rest from the road.
Here the goose is cooked Here the fat is fried And nothing's overlooked Till I'm satisfied -
Charge'em for the lice Extra for the mice Two percent for looking in the mirror twice.

Servant to the poor Butler to the great Comforter, philosopher and lifelong mate Everybody's boon companion Gives'em everything he's got -  The Portly Customer has discovered he's been robbed. He comes out to protest, holding out his emptied wallet. At once two of Thenardier's thugs grab him and hustle him off.
Dirty bunch of geezers Jesus! What a sorry little lot!
What a cruel trick of nature Landed me with such a louse.
Everybody raise a glass!
You are very welcome here!
Take a glass!
What to do? What to say Shall you carry our treasure away?
Cosette -
Not bad!
Should have struck the iron, Struck it while it's hot.
Everyone here, you know your place -
Please, M'sieur, come this way.
Men like me don't forget -
You know me! I know you!
You will have a job to find him!
In the absence of a victim, Dear Inspector, may I go?
I smell profit here!
You shut your mouth!
Who is this hussy?
Eponine, get on home!
Don't interfere!
One little scream and you'll regret it for a year!
Make for the sewers!
You wait, my girl!
Here's a hint of gold Stuck into a tooth -
Well, someone's got to clean'em up, my friends, Before the little harvest Disappears into the mud.
Here's a tasty ring Pretty little thing Heart's no longer going And he's lived his little time, But his watch is ticking yet.
There! That way!
Pity to disturb you at a feast like this But 500 francs surely wouldn't come amiss.
Ain't it a laugh?
Beggar at the feast! Master of the dance!
But we're the ones who take it -
One thing more! One small doubt!
Watch'em run amuck!
Watch'em run amuck Catch'em as they fall Never know your luck When there's a free-for-all!
Te lucis ante terminum Rerum Creator poscimus Ut pro tua clementia Sis praesul et custodia...
Hostemque nostrum comprime Ne polluantur corpora...
Look down and see the beggars at your feet!
Look down, look down, Upon your fellow man!
Look down and show some mercy if you can!
Gavroche!
There was a time we killed the King We tried to change the world too fast.
Take your chance!
That inspector thinks he's something But it's me who runs this town!
Listen! Listen to me!
General Lamarque is dead!
Fleas will bite!
Liar!
Good evening, dear Inspector.
Course I do!
Letter for Cosette.
Something for you, something for me. Who needs charity?

Don't shoot! I know him! He's no soldier!  Suddenly Valjean spots a couple of snipers creeping over the roofs to gain an angle of attack on them. They are aiming at Enjolras. Swiftly Valjean grabs a gun and shoots up at them sending them scattering. Quickly other students join in and the snipers are driven back.
I volunteer!
Look at me, I'm almost there!
Little people know When little people fight We may look easy pickings But we've got some bite!
So you'd better run for cover When the pup grows -
When's it gonna end?
Listen, everybody!
But a jubilant shout!
Some will fall and some will live Will you stand up and take your chance?
Bravo, little Gavroche!
Yet we will not abandon those Who still live in fear.
Come back, Gavroche! Don't you dare!
No-o!
Make'em pay for every man!
When we gonna live?
Something's gotta happen now!
Marius, wake up!
He's back!
Here comes a man in uniform!
Approach and show your face!
You've got some years behind you, sir.
You see that prisoner over there?
Here's to witty girls Who went to our beds!
Someone pull him down right now!
Something's gotta give!
It'll come, it'll come, it'll come...
Where are the leaders of the land?
Lamarque is ill and fading fast -
Before we cut the fat ones down to size?
The time is near...
It is time for us all To decide who we are.
Marius, you're no longer a child -
Lamarque is dead...
Let us welcome it gladly with courage and cheer!
One more day before the storm!
At the barricades of freedom!
When our ranks begin to form -
Then join in the fight That will give you the right To be free!
Will you give all you can give So that our banner may advance?
To the barricades!
Here upon these stones We will build our barricade.
Wait!
Red, the blood of angry men!
Have faith!
Tie this man and take him To the tavern in there!
Take this man. Bring him through.

When are they coming!?  Silence.  Suddenly, out of the darkness, the students and citizens at the barricade here an ominous distant sound. The sound of marching feet, hundreds of men, marching in unison. First soft, then building louder and louder, closer and closer.
French Revolution.
They were the first to fall. The first to fall upon this barricade.
For your presence of mind, For the deed you have done, I will thank you, M'sieur, When our battle is won.
If it is in my power.
Do what you have to do -
The enemy may be regrouping!
Courfeyrac, you take the watch -
Marius, rest.
The people have not stirred.
The people have not heard, Yet we will not abandon those who cannot hear.
Let us die facing our foes!
Let others rise to take our place Until the earth is free!
Only one man, General Lamarque Speaks for the people here below!
With all the anger in the land, How long before the Judgement Day?
Eponine! Who was that girl?
Eponine, find her for me!
Anything!
Eponine, do this for me, Discover where she lives.
A ghost, you say? A ghost maybe!
Had you seen her today You might know how it feels To be struck to the bone By a moment of breathless delight!
I feel my soul on fire!
My world if she's not there!
The colour of desire!
The colour of despair!
In my life She has burst like the music of angels The light of the sun!
Waiting near!
A heart full of love!
A heart full of song!
My name is Marius Pontmercy.
Cosette... I don't know what to say -
I am lost -
A heart full of light -
And you must never go away, Cosette - Cosette!
Do I dream?
A heart full of love -
A single look and then I knew!
From today -
Do I follow where she goes?
Shall I join my brothers there?
Do I stay and do I dare?
My place is here!
Clear out or I'll blow up the barricade!
And myself with it!
Eponine! What have you done?
Eponine, you're hurt!
But you will live, Eponine - Dear God above!
You will live a hundred years If I could show you how...
Hush-a-bye, dear Eponine You won't feel any pain A little fall of rain Can hardly hurt you now I'm here.
I will stay with you Till you are sleeping.
Her name was Eponine!
Will you take this for me?
Thank you, M'sieur.
Do I care if I should die Now she goes across the sea?
I will go into the streets.
Grandfather...
There's a grief that can't be spoken There's a pain goes on and on Empty chairs at empty tables Now my friends are dead and gone.
And tomorrow never came...
Oh my friends, my friends, forgive me That I live and you are gone There's a grief that can't be spoken There's a pain goes on and on...
Every day I wonder every day Who it was brought me here From the barricade.
Cosette, Cosette!
Waiting for you!
M'sieur, this is a day I never can forget.
You're Jean Valjean!
Monsieur, you cannot leave!
I give my word.
For the sake of Cosette, it must be so.
All he asked for me to   say He's on a journey, far   away.
In God's name say what you have to say.
Not so loud! Here's for you.
It's you who must forgive a thoughtless fool!
Before the barricades arise?
Red!
Black!
The dark of ages past! Red - a world about to dawn!
They will come when we call!
Here's to them -
And here's to you!
Enjolras! At Notre Dame The sections are prepared!
Dogs will bark!
We fight here in her name...
A spy who calls himself Javert!
Make'em pay through the nose!
Marius! You've come back to us!
Rest, Marius. No more harsh words between us. I just thank God you're alive.
You've come home. To all of us.
Thank God, thank God you are here!
Little he knows -

It's the police! Disappear! Run for it! It's Javert!  The gang spill out into the street to find themselves confronted by Javert now with his men. Marius watches, as does Gavroche, drawn by the rumpus.
Cosette! Now I remember...
That bourgeois two-a-penny thing!
What will you give me?
Got you all excited now, But God knows what you see in her.
You see? I told you so!
Every word that he says Is a dagger in me!
He was never mine to lose Why regret What could not be?
These are words he'll never say Not to me, not to me Not for me!
His heart full of love...
He will never feel this way.
I know this house, I tell you!
I'm gonna scream! I'm gonna warn them here!
And now I'm all alone again -
Without a face to say hello to.
In the rain The pavement shines like silver All the lights Are misty in the river In the darkness the trees are full of starlight And all I see is him and me forever and forever!
I came to tell you she's gone.
One more day all on my own...
One more day with him not caring...
What a life I might have known...
But he never saw me there.
One more day on my own...
Here... It's from Cosette...
Don't be too hard on me...
Don't you fret, M'sieur Marius -
Just hold me now, and let it be.
The rain can't hurt me now...
So don't you fret, M'sieur Marius I don't feel any pain A little fall of rain Can hardly hurt me now...
And you will keep me close And rain..
At Rue du Bac They're straining at the leash!
Sing with me the songs we knew!
Some wine, and say what's going on!
I am agog! I am aghast!
And here he comes like Don Juan!
Red!
Black!
A volunteer like you!
He's going to get it too!  Javert looks up and meets Valjean's eyes. A steady shared look.
Drink with me to days gone by!
Long live the republic!
They will come one and all!
They will do what is right.
What were you thinking!  As everyone surrounds Marius in amazement he spots Eponine lying propped against the barricade.
She will not be betrayed...
This is his lair!
Go home, Eponine!
He keeps himself to himself He's staying close to the ground.
It's your brat Eponine!
What do I care Who you should rob?
What have we here?
She's going soft!
Happens to all!
The time is now!
Tomorrow we'll discover What our God in heaven has in store -
Black, the dark of ages past!
Drink with me To days gone by!
See! The people unite!
So what are we going to do With this snake in the grass?
She will not die in vain...
You wear an army uniform.
Here's to pretty girls Who went to our heads!
Who's there?
Fire!
Who's there? Get down!
Fire!
Blow it up then and take yourself with it!
You at the barricades listen to this!
Vive la France!
Nothing here!
Did you see them Going off to fight?
Children of the barricade Who didn't last the night.
No one ever told them that A summer day can kill.
Did you see them Lying where they died?
Where's that new world Now the fighting's done?
Did you see them lying side by side?
Who will wake them?
No one ever will.
They were schoolboys Never held a gun Fighting for a new world that Would rise up like the sun.
